name: Classic Movies From European Literature Quiz | Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: Flaubert's 'Madame Bovary' was made into a movie in which Van Heflin played the male lead. Who played the title role?
questions.explanation:
Jennifer Jones.

	A forgotten actress today. But, she did good work.

questions.text: Lew Ayres starred in a movie version of Erich Maria Remarque's 'All Quiet on the Western Front'. Who was the director?
Leo Tolstoy's 'War and Peace' was made into a movie. Who were the stars?
Many of the novels of Charles Dickens have been turned into movies. Which of the following actors starred in 'A Tale of Two Cities'?
questions.explanation:
Ronald Colman.

	Sim was great in 'A Christmas Carol'.

questions.text: Greta Garbo had a memorable role in 'Camille'. Who wrote the novel?
questions.explanation:
Alexandre Dumas.

	Her most famous role?

questions.text: Laurence Olivier turned in a memorable performance in Emily Bronte's 'Wuthering Heights'. Who played the female lead?
questions.explanation:
Merle Oberon.

	If you like that sort of thing.

questions.text: 'Of Human Bondage' included fine performances by Bette Davis and Leslie Howard. Who wrote the novel?
Who starred in the 1965 film adaptation of Joseph Conrad's 'Lord Jim'?
Who played the poor unfortunate Josef K. in Kafka's 'The Trial'?
questions.explanation:
Anthony Perkins.

	Always a nervous, up-tight guy.

questions.text: There is also a movie version of 'The Light that Failed'. Who is the author of the novel?
